title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package directions.
While pasta cooks, heat a large skillet over medium heat and cook pancetta until crispy.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, both cheeses, and plenty of black pepper.
Reserve 1 cup pasta water before draining the spaghetti.
Add hot pasta to the skillet with pancetta and toss to combine.
Remove from heat and quickly stir in egg mixture, adding pasta water as needed.
Serve immediately with extra cheese and black pepper.
tips: The key to perfect carbonara is working quickly and using the pasta's heat to cook the eggs without scrambling them.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
ingredients: 1 kg chicken breast, cut into chunks
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, lemon juice, and half the spices for at least 30 minutes.
Grill or pan-fry chicken pieces until cooked through and slightly charred.
In a large pan, sauté onions until golden brown.
Add remaining garlic, ginger, and spices. Cook for 1 minute.
Add canned tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in coconut milk and butter, simmer for 5 minutes.
Add cooked chicken and simmer for 10 more minutes.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice or naan.
tips: For extra flavor, marinate the chicken overnight. Adjust spice levels to your preference.

title: Beef Tacos
summary: Soft tortillas filled with seasoned ground beef, lettuce, cheese, and salsa.
instructions: Brown ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Drain excess fat and add taco seasoning with 1/4 cup water.
Simmer for 5 minutes until sauce thickens.
Warm tortillas in microwave or dry skillet.
Fill each tortilla with beef mixture.
Top with lettuce, cheese, tomatoes, and onions.
Serve with sour cream, salsa, avocado, and lime wedges.
tips: Let everyone build their own tacos for a fun, interactive meal!

title: Caesar Salad
summary: Crisp romaine lettuce with parmesan cheese, croutons, and creamy Caesar dressing.
instructions: Wash and dry romaine lettuce thoroughly, then chop into bite-sized pieces.
For dressing, mash garlic and anchovies into a paste.
Whisk in lemon juice, mustard, and egg yolk.
Slowly drizzle in olive oil while whisking to emulsify.
Season with salt and pepper.
Toss lettuce with dressing until well coated.
Top with parmesan cheese and croutons.
Serve immediately.
tips: For food safety, use pasteurized eggs or substitute with mayonnaise for the egg yolk.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
summary: Soft and chewy cookies loaded with chocolate chips, perfect for dessert.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt in a bowl.
In a large bowl, beat butter and both sugars until creamy.
Beat in eggs and vanilla extract.
Gradually blend in flour mixture.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake 9-11 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool on baking sheet for 2 minutes before removing.
tips: For chewier cookies, slightly underbake them. For crispier cookies, bake a minute or two longer.

title: Margherita Pizza
summary: Classic Italian pizza with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, and basil leaves.
instructions: Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C) with pizza stone if available.
Roll out pizza dough on floured surface.
Transfer to pizza pan dusted with cornmeal.
Spread pizza sauce evenly over dough.
Arrange mozzarella slices over sauce.
Add tomato slices and season with salt and pepper.
Drizzle with olive oil.
Bake 12-15 minutes until crust is golden and cheese bubbles.
Top with fresh basil leaves before serving.
tips: For best results, use a pizza stone and let the dough come to room temperature before rolling.
